I love this game because it has a good collection of all my favorite characters from horror movies I love.
Honestly the game is good its that it keeps crashing now it didn't in the past now I can't even play 1 match without it crashing and risking my rank

I feel all competitive games have toxic communities within of various sizes. In many of those games, there are systems in place that curb the expression of toxic behavior in game w/ significant penalties for offenders.

Dead by Daylight does not have systems in place for this behavior. It also doesn't help that Dead by Daylight falls into a niche that caters toxic behavior, primarily expressed in game play.

As a killer, you will run into skilled survivors and you will run into 4 man squads on coms, which can both tear you apart as killer. As a survivor you will run into some un-fun and unfair situations with 2 or 3 of the killer cast, who are overwhelmingly overtuned in comparison to the rest of the cast.

But it is what happens when a larger section of the community feels that they have been slighted by the developers when a game changing patch occurs.  This most recent patch has unleashed the largest shit-storm I have ever scene, as the developers turned the tables on the survivor community by adjusting base stats for hits, endurance boosts, breaking pallents/kicking gens, gen regression/progression, and a few others more towards the killer side; further gutting many of the 2nd chance perks that survivors statistically overwhelmingly used to ensure a much easier victory, so much so that unless the Killer were to also use the most meta perks, builds, and just the killer character themselves to counter the meta that developed.  These changes were meant to reduce the pressure to keep using these builds, perks, etc and to generate an greater variety of Killers and gameplay styles to the game.

The response of those who are so upset that these changes occurred have been able to bring their expression into the game. Today you will have at least one survivor DC every match, and in the mean time there are many killer mains out there who still continue to play the Strong meta killers and builds that will just trash survivors w/o these second chance perks. But the worst of it all is the insane amount of hacking and game hijacking that is occurring now in the general public, and insanely so in the content maker front.

In summary, Dead by Daylight's player base is populated w/ a lot of folks at the end of the day, come to play this game to bully their opponents into the ground, and will belittle who for losing, or call you trash for winning, w/ the most aggressive bullies just d/c ing mid game, or just straight up hacking to ruin the experience.

Dead by Daylight does not have a cheating problem, it has a bullying problem. Whether or not BHVR will begin to moderate their game or implement and aggressive anti-cheating system into the game is yet to be seen. But as long as this is not done, then I cannot recommend anyone purchase or invest into this game.

If you're into suffering and playing with your friends, only for them to get toxic as hell and even disconnect when facing a single type of killer, this is your game. While it is at times a little spooky and fun for the short 5 minutes, the tunneling, proxy camping, and otherwise cheap tactics that a majority of the community plays, ruins that and drives my urge to play this game lower and lower.

Man listen, if you like slasher movies and tend to root for the villain then this is for you, straight up. I only play killer, the licensed characters such as Michael, Freddy, Leatherface, Pinhead and the gang are the best as an 80's slasher fanatic. If they'd just add Jason Voorhees already then this would be complete.
I already have over 700 hours in this game, so yes i recommend this game to anyone who likes horror <3

The longer this game has been out the less and less enjoyable it is. There has been no signifigant change to the game in years that will keep me coming back. Simple improvements seem to be on the backburner for more content for the devs to line their pockets.
Good with friends, play killer if you don't get mad.
This is my favorite game I am absolutely obsessed with it and have been sucked into the DBD abyss. I have spent so much time on this game and it is so good.

The game is good but too toxic (no joke, it is). Not beginner friendly at all and you have to buy a lot of DLC content to get all the perks/ability to enjoy to game, so if you are going to buy the game. It's better to buy all package

and even after that, you need to grind to be able to use those perks

yes you can get some perks in-game, but you have to be super lucky or grind like a mindless idiot, like a lot and this game is similar to the competitive game so you will have to grind with a lot of disadvantages

Forget the Solo queue, stay from it. Find Friends. No one cares about solo queue including devs themselves
The grind is a rough for beginners but otherwise fun to play survive with friends killer
horrible bad no i do not approve

It is fun, but some of the changes that were recently made to the game have made it unappealing for older players. If it is you first time playing, you should easily adjust to the changes, and won't have as much as a problem.
A great fun escape/murder game, just like the game "tag". The much needed adrenaline is guaranteed. Don't take it seriously tho. :)

Si lo recomiendo pero desde ya te aviso que lo vas a odiar y amar al mismo tiempo . Esta bueno porque  lo podes jugar con amigos siendo superviviente o solo siendo asesino . El juego esta desbalanceado  a favor de los superivivientes que se comunican por discord u otra aplicacion externa al videojuego , pero igual es bastante jugable de asesino . La empresa mete contenido constantemente , agregando skins o DLC de asesinos y supervivientes famosos por peliculas u otros juegos y tambien otros dlc los inventan ellos .

The game is of course normal, but sometimes you come in and it's not cool. If the developers brought a normal balance it would be cool. And then you go in for a survivor, they beat you up and you go to cry into your pillow...

After playing Dead by Daylight for the past 3 months, I am enjoying the basic selection of Survivors (5 basic characters) and Killers (5 basic characters). The rounds of 4 versus 1 take 20 minutes each. I enjoy the random match making process.
